messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] "foreign" languages
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/20/2001 10:45:29 AM Pacific Standard Time, ... You must have almost as big a cultural gap as my husband and I do (he is from Iran, I grew
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/20/2001 10:45:29 AM Pacific Standard Time,
jnjstau@... writes:


> I am a born and bred Texan, who sounds like "Ma Kettle" to most people. Dh
> is from New Jersey. When we first met, he talked so fast that much of the
> time I didn't have a clue what he said. I just tended to smile and nod my
> head.

You must have almost as big a cultural gap as my husband and I do (he is from
Iran, I grew up a Southern California surfer girl <G>).

--pam


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: "foreign" languages
messages.msgSnippet: I am a born and bred Texan, who sounds like Ma Kettle to most people.  Dh is from New Jersey.  When we first met, he talked so fast that much of the time I
messages.messageBody:
I am a born and bred Texan, who sounds like "Ma Kettle" to most people. Dh
is from New Jersey. When we first met, he talked so fast that much of the
time I didn't have a clue what he said. I just tended to smile and nod my
head.

Julie
